page.title: 08Cossham Hospital. Kingswood.
page.content: {Cossham Memorial Hospital}opened in 1907 as a result of an endowment by {Handel Cossham,}a local coal-owner and benefactor. At present there are 4 wards containing 77 beds, of which 36 are for{surgical}cases and 41 are for {medical.}There are no children's wards and there is no longer a{casualty {department.}The majority of patients are elderly. The hospital has 3 permanent{doctors}and 15{consultants who visit regularly. There is one main {operating theatre}where major operations can be performed. The {out-patients' department}dealt with a total of 12,998 cases during 1984. A new{Joints Department}is to be opened this year. The future of the Hospital is uncertain - surgical facilities may be withdrawn so that only medical and long-term care patients are admitted.
